title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: husband was killed in the wars Lang Lang ago in a forgotten battle — she Leeves on a sma' pension in a laigh and Lonely house, — that bespeak constant communion wi' the dead, and oae want either o' a meek and mournfu' sympathy wi' the leevin, provided only ye show them hy the considerate genl Leo'  your manner, when you chance to oa' on them on a week-day, or xneel them al the bark on Sabbath, thai von ken something o' their history, and has a Christian feelin for their oncomplainiii affliction.
